title: Luminary: New Perspectives on Arts of the Americas
hero_caption: Diego Rivera. Weaving (detail), 1936. Gift of Josephine Wallace KixMiller in memory of her mother, Julie F. Miller, who purchased the painting from the artist at his studio in Mexico in 1936. © 2018 Banco de México Diego Rivera Frida Kahlo Museums Trust, Mexico, D.F. / Artists Rights Society (ARS), New York.
short_description: Enjoy a panel conversation between curators of Arts of the Americas and hear about some of their favorite pieces from the collection before visiting the newly reinstalled galleries to experience them alongside fellow Luminary members.
list_description: Enjoy a panel conversation between curators of Arts of the Americas and hear about some of their favorite pieces from the collection before visiting the newly reinstalled galleries to experience them alongside fellow Luminary members.
description:
Join Luminary and Art Institute curators to learn how iconic works of art in the Arts of the Americas galleries have been reinstalled to shed new light on familiar narratives. Sarah Kelly Oehler, Field-McCormick Chair and Curator of Arts of the Americas, will be joined in conversation by Andrew Hamilton, associate curator of Arts of the Americas; Annelise K. Madsen, Gilda and Henry Buchbinder Associate Curator; and Elizabeth McGoey, Ann S. and Samuel M. Mencoff Associate Curator.

After hearing about the new installation and the curators' favorite pieces from the collection, enjoy a visit to the reinstalled galleries alongside fellow Luminary members.

This event is exclusive to Luminary members, and advance registration is required.

To ensure a safe gallery experience, all guests must follow the visiting policies in place at the time of the event. This event takes place when the museum is closed to the public. Coat check and valet services will be available.
